_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
QUALITY FEED AND FERTILIZER, INC. IS AN AGRICULTURAL BUSINESS WHICH PRIMARILY SERVICES AREA CROP AND LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS WITH ESSENTIAL INPUTS FOR AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION.

OUR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA PLANT CONSIST OF 1 - 18,000 GALLON TANK WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 79,000 POUNDS WHEN FILLED TO 85 PERCENT.  WITH 25 ADDITIONAL NURSE TANKS, THE TOTAL CAPACITY WILL INCREASE TO 189,000 POUNDS.   OUR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA PLANT IS IN STRICT ACCORDANCE WITH ALL LOCAL, FEDERAL AND STATE RULES AND REGULATIONS.  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR PLANT EACH YEAR AND WE RESPOND TO ALL OF THEIR REQUEST FOR IMPROVEMENTS.  ALL OF OUR SAFETY EQUIPMENT (PPE AND PLANT) ARE INSPECTED ON A REGULAR BASIS AND REPLACED WHEN NECESSARY.  wE PLAN NO CHANGES IN SAFETY EQUIPMENT AT THIS PLANT, BUT WILL DO SO AS THE BUDGET ALLOWS.

THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD RELEASE A TOXIC GAS CLOUD WITH A TOTAL OF 79,000 POUNDS HAVING A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF 1.89 MILES AND WOULD AFFECT APPROXIMATELY 80 AREA RESIDENTS.   PUBLIC RECEPTORS IN THE AREA ARE A SMALL SCHOOL WITH A PLAYGROUND AND PUBLIC RESIDENCES IN RURAL MCPHERSON COUNTY.  THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO WOULD HAVE A TRANSFER HOSE RUPTURING AND RELEASING APPROXIMATELY 12,000 POUNDS IN 2 MINUTES WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF .83 MILES AFFECTING NEARLY 50 AREA RESIDENTS.

OUR EMPLOYEES WHO WORK IN THE AMMONIA PLANT ARE TRAINED ON A REGULAR BASIS IN SAFETY INFORMATION, HAZARDS, OPERATING PROCEDURES AND MAINTENANCE PRACTICES.  THE  EMPLOYEES ALWAYS PUT SAFETY FIRST AND IS EVIDENT BY ALWAYS USING GOGGLES AND THE APPROPRIATE GLOVES WHILE FILLING NURSE TANKS.  WITH THIS TRAINING IN MIND, IT MAKES IT ESPECIALLY EASY TO REPORT THAT NO INJURY ACCIDENTS OR PROPERTY DAMAGE HAVE OCCURRED IN THE LAST FIVE YEARS AT THE STORAGE FACILITY.

THIS COMPANY'S EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED WITH THE MOUNDRIDGE FIRE DEPARTMENT.  THEY'VE TOURED OUR FACILITY AND ARE AWARE OF THE MANY SAFETY PROCESSESS THAT WE PRESENTLY HAVE IN PLACE.  THEY ALSO, HAVE A
COPY OF OUR EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN AND HAVE AGREED TO BE OUR FIRST RESPONDER IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY.
